intro: Topobea castanedae, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
